task.summary: SteamPipeline now works with itemloader. The pipeline calls holds a temporary duplicate variable and the db_connector searches the database for duplicate entries.
Everything now works. It can scan the whole search page of steam and get titles and prices.

New table in the database with all the details for a steam game. Update everything, including the dbconnector, steam_item, and a new spider file steam_spider to handle. Scanning one game works fine, can't crawl links thought!

Updated the database to use the proper variable types and update steam_item, steam_spider and db_connector to accommodate the changes. In steam_spider i changed slightly the reviews part using nth-child(2) to get the proper value for all reviews.

Updated steam_item to check if price can be converted to float, if not ('Free to Play', 'Free', etc) returns 0. Added logging to db_connector (creates steam_database.log) as well as the 'validate' function for dates, returns 1000-01-01 if not valid date format. Added logging to steam_spider (creates steam_spider.log) and added more css/xpath for 'game_original_price' and 'game_current_price', if nothing is found (known problem so far games with Package Info button) it returns 0.10. Fixed the redirect middleware in settings by adding None to the default one.

Added humble bundle stuff. Almost done with the game_search_spider apart from loading new pages (needs more testing). Done with humble_item / pipeline and loader. Need to create the db connector (currently it's a copy paste of the steam one)
Humble db_connector works. And humble spider also works along with iterating through all the links.

MESSAGE.value: SteamPipeline now works with itemloader. The pipeline calls holds a temporary duplicate variable and the db_connector searches the database for duplicate entries.
Everything now works. It can scan the whole search page of steam and get titles and prices.

New table in the database with all the details for a steam game. Update everything, including the dbconnector, steam_item, and a new spider file steam_spider to handle. Scanning one game works fine, can't crawl links thought!

Updated the database to use the proper variable types and update steam_item, steam_spider and db_connector to accommodate the changes. In steam_spider i changed slightly the reviews part using nth-child(2) to get the proper value for all reviews.

Updated steam_item to check if price can be converted to float, if not ('Free to Play', 'Free', etc) returns 0. Added logging to db_connector (creates steam_database.log) as well as the 'validate' function for dates, returns 1000-01-01 if not valid date format. Added logging to steam_spider (creates steam_spider.log) and added more css/xpath for 'game_original_price' and 'game_current_price', if nothing is found (known problem so far games with Package Info button) it returns 0.10. Fixed the redirect middleware in settings by adding None to the default one.

Added humble bundle stuff. Almost done with the game_search_spider apart from loading new pages (needs more testing). Done with humble_item / pipeline and loader. Need to create the db connector (currently it's a copy paste of the steam one)
Humble db_connector works. And humble spider also works along with iterating through all the links.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Humble db_connector works. And humble spider also works along with iterating through all the links.
